title: Can anyone help explain these neck ultrasound results?
text:
51F. Levothyroxine, sertraline, telmisartan, Zepbound, probiotic, vitamin D3. High BP, obesity, depression/anxiety, NAFLD. Had an ultrasound on my neck as I was having some pain that could not be explained. The pain has now gone away as it's been several days since my scan. Got the results of the ultrasound and would appreciate information on what this sentence means, and is it concerning? "Small soft tissue nodules are seen in the soft tissues superficial to the left submandibular gland. These appear to contain fatty hila."

# Impression

IMPRESSION:  
1. What appears to be a normal left submandibular gland is seen.  
2. 2 small lymph nodes are seen superficial to the left submandibular  
gland.  


# Narrative

Clinical:  
  
left side neck pain/possible mass, Neck pain  
  
COMPARISON:  
  
CT soft tissues of the neck 5/31/2023  
  
FINDINGS:  
  
Ultrasound of the left submandibular region was performed.  
  
What appears to be a normal left submandibular gland is seen,  
measuring 3.1 x 2.4 x 1.4 cm.  
  
Small soft tissue nodules are seen in the soft tissues superficial to  
the left submandibular gland. These appear to contain fatty hila.  
Larger measures 0.9 x 0.6 x 0.5 cm and the smaller measures 0.5 x 0  
0.5 to 0.3 cm.  
  
No abnormal mass or fluid collection is seen.
relevance_reason: No bariatric or PBH-related context identified.
